intro: Paepalanthus acutalis, commonly known as the sharp-leaved puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and striking inflorescences. The plant produces showy, spadix-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, dry conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
